page.title: 05RELIGION AND MORALITY
page.content:
{ {All figures relate to 300 households {surveyed.
35% of people go to church regularly. This is higher than the 10% official average for Merseyside.43% of church_goers are Catholic, the rest are Protestant of various denominations. Regular church_goers have been church members for a long time. 82% are or have been married.11% are or have been divorced. 17% of married people were not married in church.96% thought that family life is important.25% have been victims of crime.19% do not vote in local elections.14% do not vote in national elections. The majority of people thought that drug abuse is the most serious moral problem at present.
